channel.title: Save Peter Sunde
channel.description:
It's time for us to give back to them what they have given to us, Peter the media spokesperson of The Pirate Bay has gotten tangled in a sticky web with the law, most of the the details are here. [url]https://www.avaaz.org/en/petition/Grant_Peter_Sundes_of_The_Pirate_Bay_plea_for_pardon/[/url]
sign or not. just an fyi for those who didn't know. I haven't seen a thread for it.

item.title: Save Peter Sunde
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Signed it, but I doubt it will do much.

Read full topic

item.title: Save Peter Sunde
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
EDIT: you know what? just nevermind.

Read full topic

item.title: Save Peter Sunde
item.dc:creator: Dr_Karamazov
item.description:
Flubly:

Well, the idea at least is that if the law is there to serve the will of the populace, not bind it, then a large enough petition shows that the law is going against that will.

Of course, the people signing this are not all from Sweden. But, I guess you get the variable of international exposure.

The Troy Davis online petition got 258,695 signatures and he was still executed. I think they’re not taken very seriously. I wonder if any institutions would trust them even if the numbers were high enough to account for their populations.

During the run up to the second Iraq war several million people protested. We still went and bombed shit.
The only time numbers matter is just before an election. The rest of the time the governments couldn’t give a shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Save Peter Sunde
item.dc:creator: Flubly
item.description:
sersoft:

I never understood how a number of votes can amount to any kind of help(money)…

Well, the idea at least is that if the law is there to serve the will of the populace, not bind it, then a large enough petition shows that the law is going against that will.

Of course, the people signing this are not all from Sweden. But, I guess you get the variable of international exposure.

The Troy Davis online petition got 258,695 signatures and he was still executed. I think they’re not taken very seriously. I wonder if any institutions would trust them even if the numbers were high enough to account for their populations.
